content.content: predict what might happen in the story
indicate how I feel in particular situations
list words in their plural form
indicate what I like and don’t like
describe a picture in a few sentences
Let’s watch a fun video about the weather and seasons.
Look at the picture of Mimi from the story below. Try to guess what happens in the story.
Play in the rain with her friends at school.
Enjoy a holiday with her family.
Mimi wakes up to get ready for school. What kind of day is it? Let’s read this story and find out!
Mimi jumps out of bed and looks outside.
What is the word for “mother” in your home language?
She puts on her school uniform.
the meal we eat in the morning
Mimi’s mother gets a phone call.
Work in pairs. Tell your partner how you feel when you have a surprise holiday.
You may use these words and say:
Tell your partner why you feel this way.
Fill in the blanks to complete each sentence.
Have fun with this interactive activity.
Who lives with Mimi? Look at the pictures and name each member of her family.
What does Mimi do in the morning after she wakes up?
How does Mimi feel when she hears she has a holiday? Which word in the story tells you this?
What would you do if you have a surprise holiday? List three things.
Work in groups. Read the story again and look at the pictures. Ask and answer questions about something you want to know about Mimi and Momo.
Does Momo also go to school with Mimi?
He is not wearing a school uniform.
After completing this section, I can:
recall and repeat facts from the story.
study a picture and answer a question about it.
Look at these words. Listen to  each one and repeat it.
Match the pictures to the correct weather words.
Have fun with this interactive activity.
After completing this section, I can:
read a word, listen to how it is pronounced and repeat it.
Identify words related to the weather.
to a word to show more than one thing.
Let’s watch a fun video about one and many.
Look at each picture and click the correct word.
Have fun with this interactive activity.
Work in pairs. Look around the room you are in. In your notebook, write the names of three things that are more than one.
After completing this section, I can:
look at pictures of things and identify whether they are one or many.
add an s to a naming word to change it from one to many.
When we look at a picture, we see many naming words. In this picture, we see
To describe this picture, we write:
The sun is in the sky. Mimi and Momo play in the garden. Grandma and Kulfi play with them. They play with a ball.
Look at this picture. In your notebook, complete these sentences to describe what you see in the picture.
everywhere. It is cold. They are wearing
After completing this section, I can:
describe a picture and write sentences using naming words.
use one and many forms of naming words correctly.
Listen to this poem about the rain. Answer the questions below.
Listen to this poem about the rain. Answer the questions below.
Where does the rain fall in the poem? Name two places or things.
How do you feel when you listen to the poem? Tell your partner.
Use the words above or a word of your choice.
Work in pairs. Talk about your favourite day. List two things you like about it.
How does the day make you feel?
What do you like to eat or drink on that day?
Which day do you not like? Tell your partner two things about it.
How does the day make you feel?
After completing this section, I can:
describe how a poem makes me feel.
express what days I like and don’t like.
Look at the weather chart below.
Read the sentences about the weather chart.
It is rainy on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, and Sunday.
It is cloudy on Tuesday and Thursday.
It is snowy on Monday and Saturday.
Now make your own weather chart like the one above. Observe the weather where you live for one week. Colour one square every day. At the end of the week, count the number of days for each kind.
